column4: I'm trynig to read a wmv3 file (video codec) and I can't get it to work.  Does anyone know what I need to install?
are you on feisty?
hmm, double clicking on it in nautilus doesn't prompt you to install some packages?
I'm on kde
hmm, what does kde use as the default player?
well, theres several, kaffine is the default, theres also vlc, mplayer, kmplayer, etc
ok, try w32codecs I guess but I thought vlc and mplayer played those now without codecs
how do I install w32codecs?  I can't find a package with apt-cache
you need a repository like medibuntu
nevermind
once I get w32, which players should be able to play?
*mplayer at least
but it is strange you can't play them already.  I'm on amd64 which doesn't have w32codecs and can play WMV3 on vlc, mplayer, and totem-gstreamer

my computer has been feeling a little sluggish, and a freind told me it was pretty slow for linux, but my cpu is not not being used (5-10%) and I have a very powerful computer... is there anyway I can look to see whats up?
you use 64 bit?  whats it like?  I heard you have to jump through some hoops... I want to get a 64bit computer this summer, so I want all the details

it takes a few extra steps to do some things.  It's not really worth it though if you just use your computer as a desktop machine.  wine has a repository now so that's easy.  flash, you need to setup nspluginwrapper which is not packaged.  And the only thing that is a pain is the java plugin.  But I ended up just using blackdown's java plugin and that's been working fine.  Anything that's open source shouldn't be a big deal on 64bit, it's usually c
is it worth it to buy an amd64 and run a 32 bit OS on it, maybe dual boot a 64 bit?
well all the processors are 64-bit now aren't they?
well, I want to get an AMD processor... intel processors aren't 64 bit (mostly) yet
but I really want my 64 bit OS to go with my 64 bit PC
well your idea of having two partitions, one with 32bit and one with 64bit would be a nice way for you to evaluate it
I'm thinking I'll have vista/XP, kubuntu and debian... not sure which will be 64 and which 32...
